commit_message:
Adding Kanagaraj Manickam candidacy for Heat

Change-Id: I52334235fd6f41989bba12a8311530d8b1a45ed1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/74/293274/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Dear all, I am announcing my candidacy for PTL role in heat for Newton release. I started to work in heat from Juno release and got opportunities to work on various features in Heat services and it's echo-system like CI, documentation. It helped me to get confident with heat service and community. Based on this, I would like to announce my candidacy and will assure to continue the team success formula "consensus building". My goal is to increase the existing user and developer experiences in heat to the next height, by working with us on following aspects in Newton release: Features: ======== * Work with Product WG to understand their road-map and bring the required features in heat. It helps to align with big-tent's over-all road-map. * Complete the Convergence initiative and bring greater value out-of it. It helps for greater scalability. * Heat is being consumed in OpenStack by TripleO, Tacker, Magnum, Murano, etc. Provide best support to these project communities for their needs in heat project. It helps to expand the foot-print of heat and enhance these services. * Implement existing and new blue-prints. It helps to strengthen heat's muscular power. * Implement hot-parser in similar line with XML parser, YAML parser, etc. It helps those open-source and closed-source solutions use the HOT template. (Once python flavor is established, other language such as java-script could be aimed.) * Over the releases, heat-templates git repo is grown up with many templates and some of them might be absolute as well. Investigate templates in this repo and make them organized based on heat features, use-cases, etc. Also make sure all are *valid* templates. It helps to make it better manageable and usable. CI: == * Continue the test-case improvements and identify the gaps/improvements in build jobs and test automations and fix them. It helps to reduce the turn-around time of authors and improves the existing heat quality further. Documentations: =============== * Make Orchestration api-refs, developer and user guides to be in sync with heat master code base. It helps to easy/enhance the heat user's life. Thanks for your considerations, Kanagaraj Manickam IRC: KanagarajM Launchpad: kanagaraj-manickam

commit_message:
Fixup stats key for replication in init_host_with_pc

We were looking for just ‘replication’ in stats, but that key isn’t
used by anyone and would always be false. We instead want to be keying
off of just replication_enabled.

Change-Id: I8f4ef8d5c6594c1548958ebac2ff63b79429cd0b
Closes-Bug: #1556315

commit_message:
Add publishing capability to buildimage-lxd job

Currently LXD image could be built but can't be published.
This patch amends job template for publishing LXD image.

Change-Id: I98555a66bbf541185a2fa0f97e926e4ca43808a5
Depends-On: Ia5a4701a828aeef93840f9c0a0e1d0bc0f4a5a2e

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints file in developer mode

Pre-empting a situation where we run into issues installing pip packages
due to unspecified upper constraints files.

We ran into this issue with the os_keystone repo which was patched in
this way: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/290446

Change-Id: I0ee1471a65ad92323e4a274f5ec2968969e291fe

commit_message:
Moved CORS middleware configuration into oslo-config-generator

The default values needed for cue's implementation of cors
middleware have been moved from paste.ini into the configuration
hooks provided by oslo.config. Furthermore, these values have been
added to the default initialization procedure. This ensures
that if a value remains unset in the configuration file, it will
fallback to using sane defaults. It also ensures that an operator
modifying the configuration will be presented with that same
set of defaults.

Change-Id: Ia179bbd7489ca128186990439a161903b7b4c28d
Closes-Bug: 1551836

added_lines: oslo.config.opts.defaults = oslo.middleware.cors = cue.common.config:set_cors_middleware_defaults

commit_message:
Instance event listener: ignore exceptions

On some compute-hyperv CI runs, the instance event listener seems
to die unexpectedly. This may happen because of some unhandled
exceptions occured in the event listener loop.

The idea is that even if an exception occures, we don't want the
event listener to stop.

Closes-Bug: #1558004

Change-Id: I9f29c3f4ff7f4792ea6ea584186e9092015f5261

commit_message:
Use tox in Makefile targets

Modify the Makefile to point at the appropriate tox targets
so that tox and Make output can be equivalent. This involves
mapping the lint target to the pep8 target and the test target
to the py27 target.

Change-Id: Iee67a6bf266c8a7ded52fe1bdfde4ce59e5bea8e

commit_message:
Add curl package to puppet nodepool element

puppet element calls install_puppet.sh script from system-config repo,
which depends on either curl or wget being installed in the system. Some
minimal images like debian jessie or ubuntu xenial miss those packages
and cause puppet element to fail when building the image.

Change-Id: Ic5124906b19b82d134a611e68fc7c5dd6fc88702

commit_message:
Remove pid-file from mysql.conf

If pid-file is specified in config then mysqld process started by OCF
script doesn't create a proper pid file. On next run mysql_status cannot
find pid thus restarting mysqld service. This cases the issue when donor
is killed during SST leaving orhaned /var/lib/mysql

Change-Id: I7d51f9138dca6cc7ed1d890d785170b35a5bf7ea
Closes-Bug: 1557975

commit_message:
Fix the context passed to get_subnets in _validate_routes

In the patch for bug #1538767 (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273278),
get_ports() is passed with context.elevated(), while later get_subnet()
for those ports is still passed with the original context. This could
cause "Subnet could not be found" exception for ports only accessible
in context.elevated() but not in the original context.

This commit replaces context with context.elevated() in get_subnet().

Related-Bug: #1538767
Change-Id: I21e73625e0a625a431bfb22f847c3b6f9671daea
(cherry picked from commit 22aed6d8061cc609da2351df23b6f5ef40ca8358)

user permissions are used to get router ports in order to validate

This change uses an elevated context instead of user context to enable

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1538767
Change-Id: I08b1d8586a4cd241a3589e8cb7151b77ab679124

commit_message:
Allow non-admins to define "external" extra-routes

Currently non-admin users can create extra-routes when the nexthop is on
router-interfaces subnets but not on external-network subnet. Indeed
user permissions are used to get router ports in order to validate
nexthops BUT non-admin users don't "see" router port on its external
network.

This change uses an elevated context instead of user context to enable
non-admins to create "external" extra-routes.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1538767
Change-Id: I08b1d8586a4cd241a3589e8cb7151b77ab679124
(cherry picked from commit 3d5d378769f0715e3254ac00b6f091a6f9f6960b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/94/291694/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Allow non-admin users to define "external" extra-routes.

Using the generic driver needs a service instance. The variable
"service_instance_name_or_id" indicates that it's possible to use
the UUID or the name of the Nova VM. Using the UUID already works and
this fixes the usage of the VM name to find the service instance.
Without this fix, you get the following error when using the name:

Failed to get Nova VM. No server with a name or ID of 'myname' exists.

"service_instance_name_or_id" indicates that it's possible to use
the UUID or the name of the Nova VM. Using the UUID already works and
this fixes the usage of the VM name to find the service instance.
Without this fix, you get the following error when using the name:

Failed to get Nova VM. No server with a name or ID of 'myname' exists.

Change-Id: I8770eff9752b76ebe490abf03a7ea6548282bf9b

Using the generic driver needs a service instance. The variable
"service_instance_name_or_id" indicates that it's possible to use
the UUID or the name of the Nova VM. Using the VM name currently only
works, when the instance is in the current tenant.
This fix searches the instance at first in the current tenant and
if not found, it searches again over all tenants.
Without this fix, you get the following error when using the name:

Failed to get Nova VM. No server with a name or ID of 'myname' exists.

Change-Id: I8770eff9752b76ebe490abf03a7ea6548282bf9b

"service_instance_name_or_id" indicates that it's possible to use
the UUID or the name of the Nova VM. Using the VM name currently only
works, when the instance is in the current tenant.
This fix searches the instance at first in the current tenant and

the UUID or the name of the Nova VM. Using the VM name currently only

This fix searches the instance at first in the current tenant and

Without this fix, you get the following error when using the name:

Failed to get Nova VM. No server with a name or ID of 'myname' exists.

commit_message:
service instance: also recognize instance name

Using the generic driver needs a service instance. The variable
"service_instance_name_or_id" indicates that it's possible to use
the UUID or the name of the Nova VM. Using the VM name currently only
works, when the instance is in the current tenant.
This fix searches the instance at first in the current tenant and
if not found, it searches again over all tenants.
Without this fix, you get the following error when using the name:

Failed to get Nova VM. No server with a name or ID of 'myname' exists.

Change-Id: I8770eff9752b76ebe490abf03a7ea6548282bf9b
Closes-Bug: #1535775

commit_message:
Fix typo in tasks/neutron_lbaas.yml

There are a few task names in tasks/neutron_lbaas.yml that reference
neutron_plugins_base instead of neutron_plugin_base.  This simple
commit fixes this.

We also remove a trailing space in the same file.

Change-Id: I7858048b6bb427c1c61b7e93aedfa9a869eab696

to the py27 target.

subject: [WIP] macvtap: Mech driver detects invalid migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-16 12:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/macvtap/mech_driver/mech_macvtap.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/811ca0ba91cead9a16d3647838a89c2d2f41057d', 'message': "[WIP] macvtap: Mech driver detects invalid migration

As of today, Macvtap agent allows invalid live migrations
from a host with interface mapping 'physnet1:eth1' to a host
with mapping 'physnet1:eth2'. Migration places the macvtap on
the target on 'eth2' instead of 'eth1'. This fix detects
such a migration in the mech driver and lets the portbinding fail.

Change-Id: I9016bd8f0f24c106f5f6c37ce69d13d863cffc10
Closes-Bug: #1550400
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] macvtap: Mech driver detects invalid migration

As of today, Macvtap agent allows invalid live migrations
from a host with interface mapping 'physnet1:eth1' to a host
with mapping 'physnet1:eth2'. Migration places the macvtap on
the target on 'eth2' instead of 'eth1'. This fix detects
such a migration in the mech driver and lets the portbinding fail.

Change-Id: I9016bd8f0f24c106f5f6c37ce69d13d863cffc10
Closes-Bug: #1550400

commit_message:
Use tox in Makefile targets

Modify the Makefile to point at the appropriate tox targets
so that tox and Make output can be equivalent. This involves
mapping the lint target to the pep8 target and the test target
to the py27 target.

Change-Id: I9dd0998ef410bdd725ec0cfde1f94379bd38b060
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch refs/changes/23/293223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @tox -e pep8 @tox -e py27
deleted_lines: @flake8 --exclude hooks/charmhelpers,tests/charmhelpers \ actions hooks unit_tests tests @charm proof @# Bundletester expects unit tests here @$(PYTHON) /usr/bin/nosetests -v --nologcapture --with-coverage unit_tests

commit_message:
Fix HNAS snapshot creation on deleted shares

Currently, HNAS driver allows creating snapshots on shares that
do not exist on the backend anymore. Fixed this by verifying if
the share exists and raising an error if it was deleted on the
backend.

Change-Id: I4881fd4304caf1d88e482ead913792b2fbbcac2c
Closes-bug: #1556186

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 15:35:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon/commit/653b65f37fb38b5cb493e6ab4e8afa4637e98acf', 'message': 'Updated neutron plugin_base setup and config(s)

The change modifies the "neutron_plugin_base" to use the simple
names as released in liberty and adds the now mainline neutron
fwaas provider as a default option when using the base ML2 plugin.

Database Migration added for the LBaaS service and FWaaS neutron plugins:
  This change was added into the the base neutron db setup task file and
  has been added when the lbaas/fwaas service offerings are enabled. This
  was added because the documentation calls for this migration to happen
  and we've not been doing it.

* Documentation has been created on how to configure FWaaS and the LBaaS.
* Documentation has been updaed to use the simple service name instead of
  the longer class path.

commit_message:
Add ability to configure Neutron FWaaS

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to enable the FWaaS panels
in Horizon.

Re-Implementation-Of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/275894/9

Change-Id: Iabfaa3d755bc2badae85325e3c6d477f4f2d620c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

added_lines: 'enable_firewall': {{ horizon_enable_neutron_fwaas | bool }},

commit_message:
Role should fail immediately when its preconditions are not met

While we were failing before, that failure occurs mid-way through
the execution of the role. If we are going to fail, let's fail as
fast as possible.

Change-Id: I97bf2934042fc7ebe7f688f1f21a3cc4360ff61d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/73/291873/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add ability to configure Neutron FWaaS

This patch implements the necessary configuration in order to
implement Neutron FWaaS.

Re-Implementation-Of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/275894/9

Change-Id: Iabfaa3d755bc2badae85325e3c6d477f4f2d620c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/13/287913/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # - router # - firewall # - lbaas # - vpnaas # - metering # - qos neutron_plugin_base: - router - metering# Please add the 'lbaas' to the neutron_plugin_base list #TODO(cloudnull): The class path will be removed from this conditional in the N cycle neutron_lbaas: "{% if 'lbaas' in neutron_plugin_base or 'neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPlugin' in neutron_plugin_base %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}"# Please add the 'router' to the neutron_plugin_base list #TODO(cloudnull): The class path will be removed from this conditional in the N cycle neutron_l3: "{% if 'router' in neutron_plugin_base or 'neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin' in neutron_plugin_base %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}"# Please add the 'metering' to the neutron_plugin_base list #TODO(cloudnull): The class path will be removed from this conditional in the N cycle neutron_metering: "{% if 'metering' in neutron_plugin_base or 'neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin' in neutron_plugin_base %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}" ## Neutron FWaaS # Please add the 'firewall' to the neutron_plugin_base list neutron_fwaas: "{% if 'firewall' in neutron_plugin_base %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}" - neutron_fwaas
deleted_lines: # - neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin # - neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin # - neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPlugin # - neutron.services.vpn.plugin.VPNDriverPlugin neutron_plugin_base: - neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin - neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin# Please add the LoadBalancerPlugin to the neutron_plugin_base list neutron_lbaas: "{% if 'neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPlugin' in neutron_plugin_base %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}"## Please add the L3RouterPlugin to the neutron_plugin_base list neutron_l3: "{% if 'neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin' in neutron_plugin_base %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}"# Please add the MeteringPlugin to the neutron_plugin_base list neutron_metering: "{% if 'neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin' in neutron_plugin_base %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}"

Use tox in Makefile targets

Modify the Makefile to point at the appropriate tox targets
so that tox and Make output can be equivalent. This involves
mapping the lint target to the pep8 target and the test target
to the py27 target.

commit_message:
Add a prelude section for Mitaka relnotes

Since reno allows us to provide a prelude section for mentioning the top-notch
new things we want to show, let's provide a quick list of things we gonna
show-up for operators needing to get the most important info at one glance.

Change-Id: I846dbf0204d559be2618f3f2cce4487c9a78822e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/292785/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: | Nova 13.0.0 release is including a lot of new features and bugfixes. It can be extremely hard to mention all the changes we introduced during that release but we beg you to read at least the upgrade section which describes the required modifications that you need to do for upgrading your cloud from 12.0.0 (Liberty) to 13.0.0 (Mitaka). That said, a few major changes are worth to notice here. This is not an exhaustive list of things to notice, rather just important things you need to know : - Latest API microversion supported for Mitaka is v2.25 - Nova now requires a second database (called 'API DB'). - A new nova-manage script allows you to perform all online DB migrations once you upgrade your cloud - EC2 API support is fully removed.

subject: Fix test_create_volume_flow test issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 14:17:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/53e35b37372d8a543086a2117551fe0e2b6156b9', 'message': "Fix test_create_volume_flow test issue

One of the tests in
cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py incorrectly
mocks time.time function which means that when there's a call to
time.time() it will raise an error because real time function doesn't
expect any arguments but the mock method does expect self as an
argument.

For some reason time.time function does not get called on every test
run, but when it does get called it will fail.

This patch fixes this by binding the mock method to the current self
instance.

Change-Id: Ia70e51719abb9a6ed357802446847ffa81d7427e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test_create_volume_flow test issue

One of the tests in
cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py incorrectly
mocks time.time function which means that when there's a call to
time.time() it will raise an error because real time function doesn't
expect any arguments but the mock method does expect self as an
argument.

For some reason time.time function does not get called on every test
run, but when it does get called it will fail.

This patch fixes this by binding the mock method to the current self
instance.

Change-Id: Ia70e51719abb9a6ed357802446847ffa81d7427e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/19/287219/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('time.time') mock_time.side_effect = self.time_inc

commit_message:
compute: include VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLED when doing VM shared storage

This patch makes sure:

* When doing shared storage
Nova is configured with block_migration_flag and live_migration_flag = '(...),VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLED'
flag for security improvements.

* When not doing shared storage
Nova is not configured with VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLED flag because it's not
supported by Qemu yet. We need to make sure the value is unset otherwise
live migration will fail when not running shared storage for VMs.

Note: this patch will be backport to stable branches. In a further
iteration, we'll probably use live_migration_tunnelled new Nova
parameter which is a simplier way to manage this feature.

Co-Authored-By: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I557c1624ee944a32b1831d504f7b189308cd1961
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/84/286584/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TUNNELLED mode provides a security enhancement when using shared storage but is not # supported when not using shared storage. # See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1301986#c12 if $rbd_ephemeral_storage { $block_migration_flag = 'VIR_MIGRATE_UNDEFINE_SOURCE, VIR_MIGRATE_PEER2PEER, VIR_MIGRATE_LIVE, VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLED, VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC' } else { $block_migration_flag = 'VIR_MIGRATE_UNDEFINE_SOURCE, VIR_MIGRATE_PEER2PEER, VIR_MIGRATE_LIVE, VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC' } nova_config { 'DEFAULT/my_ip': value => $ipaddress; 'DEFAULT/linuxnet_interface_driver': value => 'nova.network.linux_net.LinuxOVSInterfaceDriver'; # block_migration_flag should be replaced by live_migration_tunnelled later in Mitaka or after. 'libvirt/block_migration_flag': value => $block_migration_flag; }

subject: VMware: add support for provider network portgroup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 10:27:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cd1612da66e8140c43e605177ed7c904929d38cd', 'message': 'VMware: add support for provider network portgroup

In the case of the VMware NSXv plugin a admin may create a provider

commit_message:
VMware: add support for provider network portgroup

In the case of the VMware NSXv plugin a admin may create a provider
network that is an existing port group. This port group will not have
the name of the neutron network UUID as it was not created by neutron.
But the name will be tne network label. In the case of a VXLAN the name
will be at of the format vds-xx-virtualwire-yy-name.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I84c3481c0acb61645ce9b6813e105a86a2c6ef02
Co-Authored-By: Ben Lin <blin@vmware.com>

commit_message:
Make sure create ceilometer alarm successful

If enable re-auth, we will use the stored context
instead of request context, then we can't create
ceilometer alarm resource. There are two problems
when create ceilometer client:
1. the stored context has no domain info, an error
raised from keystone: BadRequest: Expecting to find
domain in project. So this patch will retrive the
user/project domain ids from the auth_ref.
2. after fix the first problem, then another error
raised from keystone: Forbidden: You are not authorized
to perform the requested action. Due keystone doesn't
allow to create a token by a trust-scoped token when
get aodh endpoint. So this patch will pass 'aodh_endpoint'
to ceilometer client to avoid this.

Change-Id: I44ed5c10b6dec6f39714f4f74cf51a10ef6104a6
Closes-Bug: #1531406

Amended table styling

Amended table styling in line with Rob Cresswell's table patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246625/

Removed search filter to save confusion with Peter's patch where the
magic search is being implemented correctly.

commit_message:
Prevent all primary keys in Neutron OVOs from being updated

Primary keys in Neutron Oslo Versioned Objects should be prevented
from being updated. In the future we may reconsider the limitation.

Current thinking is that you would delete/add instead of update.

commit_message:
Add legacy_names to properties/attributes schemas

Add legacy_names to properties and attributes schemas
to show associated with current properties/attributes
names. Also, add replacing old properties/attributes
values to new.

bp deprecating-improvements
Change-Id: I2c278d041f81ab5b638df637499c2b07c6432355

commit_message:
Fix the incorrect use of attribute

The use of get_attribute instead of get_property can fix the issue, but since
the templates were creatd for specific tests as explained in the bug it is
good to clean up clutterd template code.

Change-Id: I7a26478d3e97c89ff2dd978ba53ba83aa3e1912a
Closes-Bug: 1557117

added_lines: # Copyright 2010 United States Government as represented by the # Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. # Copyright 2011 Justin Santa Barbara # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging import sys import time from eventlet import event from eventlet import greenthread from smaug.i18n import _LE, _LW LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) # NOTE(zyluo): This lambda function was declared to avoid mocking collisions # with time.time() called in the standard logging module # during unittests. _ts = lambda: time.time() class LoopingCallDone(Exception): """Exception to break out and stop a LoopingCallBase. The poll-function passed to LoopingCallBase can raise this exception to break out of the loop normally. This is somewhat analogous to StopIteration. An optional return-value can be included as the argument to the exception; this return-value will be returned by LoopingCallBase.wait() """ def __init__(self, retvalue=True): """:param retvalue: Value that LoopingCallBase.wait() should return.""" self.retvalue = retvalue class LoopingCallBase(object): def __init__(self, f=None, *args, **kw): self.args = args self.kw = kw self.f = f self._running = False self.done = None def stop(self): self._running = False def wait(self): return self.done.wait() class FixedIntervalLoopingCall(LoopingCallBase): """A fixed interval looping call.""" def start(self, interval, initial_delay=None): self._running = True done = event.Event() def _inner(): if initial_delay: greenthread.sleep(initial_delay) try: while self._running: start = _ts() self.f(*self.args, **self.kw) end = _ts() if not self._running: break delay = end - start - interval if delay > 0: LOG.warn(_LW('task %(func_name)r run outlasted ' 'interval by %(delay).2f sec'), {'func_name': self.f, 'delay': delay}) greenthread.sleep(-delay if delay < 0 else 0) except LoopingCallDone as e: self.stop() done.send(e.retvalue) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE('in fixed duration looping call')) done.send_exception(*sys.exc_info()) return else: done.send(True) self.done = done greenthread.spawn_n(_inner) return self.done class DynamicLoopingCall(LoopingCallBase): """A looping call which sleeps until the next known event. The function called should return how long to sleep for before being called again. """ def start(self, initial_delay=None, periodic_interval_max=None): self._running = True done = event.Event() def _inner(): if initial_delay: greenthread.sleep(initial_delay) try: while self._running: idle = self.f(*self.args, **self.kw) if not self._running: break if periodic_interval_max is not None: idle = min(idle, periodic_interval_max) LOG.debug('Dynamic looping call %(func_name)r sleeping ' 'for %(idle).02f seconds', {'func_name': self.f, 'idle': idle}) greenthread.sleep(idle) except LoopingCallDone as e: self.stop() done.send(e.retvalue) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE('in dynamic looping call')) done.send_exception(*sys.exc_info()) return else: done.send(True) self.done = done greenthread.spawn(_inner) return self.done

commit_message:
Update online-schema-upgrades spec

This commit updates the spec to add a section on how to enforce the
online data migrations to be completed before running a release that
will fail if they weren't.

Two typo's are also fixed.

Implements: blueprint online-schema-upgrades

Change-Id: I59a5acfd2ba9411c906ae525b66f8a0a1d5b0378
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/44/264744/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: As N is reading from new place, before starting any N's service we need to make sure that all the CGs are migrated. To enforce that, as a first N's migration we should merge a dummy one that will block subsequent ones if there are items that weren't migrated yet. place. Moreover - SQLAlchemy models in O's services doesn't have a notion offollow this guideline.
deleted_lines: place. Moreover - SQLAlchemy models in N's services doesn't have a notion offollow this guidline.

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent gate and lint failures for os-swift

Gate was failing due to a race condition whereby the partition is not ready
and so the first mounted partitions fails to mount - causing hosts to fail.

Adding a retry/delay on failures in the mount task should resolve this issue.

ansible-lint failures were occurring due to a recent release of ansible-lint
Since the gate failure cannot be merged without the linting fix, this change
also contains I0cc973867d9c279eb6ea05decc5ebccfaa19c7b0 to break the co-
dependency between this and the other patch.

Change-Id: I3f4daaed764c4cad8a07408fedf8d0cba570a344

commit_message:
Fix update of access rules in ZFSonLinux driver

Recently merged commit [1] removed default values for "update_access"
interface of all drivers, but didn't fix usage of that
interface for ZFSonLinux driver that led to TypeError exception.

So, provide "add_rules" and "delete_rules" args always as
they are required now.

Driver methods that were broken and being fixed are following:
- Create replica
- Update replica
- Promote replica

[1] I86f4ccc9d496ec6183bd0fa5be9a77c3451378d5

Change-Id: Ic34f8e51436b45e4129aac597fb22428d21f2bae
Closes-Bug: #1557885

commit_message:
Add scenario for testing ironic without glance

In kilo release it was made possible for ironic to download images
from http servers and from conductor filesystem. This change adds a
scenario testing usecase of deploying nodes with ironic, with images
located outside of glance.

Depends-On: I6fd393390389c4c643b93198fa461fc2adc415ae

Change-Id: I171e85cb8a21fae4da45028f1f798988a36f6c95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/07/178607/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import base64 import BaseHTTPServer import gzip import json import os import re import shutil import SimpleHTTPServer import subprocess import tempfile import threading import time import httplib2 from oslo_concurrency import lockutils from oslo_log import log as logging from six.moves.urllib import parse as urlparse from tempest_lib import exceptions as tempest_lib_exc from tempest import clients from tempest import config from tempest.scenario import manager from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF CONF.import_opt('active_timeout', 'tempest.config', group='baremetal') CONF.import_opt('deploy_img_dir', 'tempest.config', group='baremetal') CONF.import_opt('unprovision_timeout', 'tempest.config', group='baremetal') CONF.import_opt('fixed_network_name', 'tempest.config', group='compute') CONF.import_opt('img_dir', 'tempest.config', group='scenario') CONF.import_opt('img_file', 'tempest.config', group='scenario') CONF.import_opt('aki_img_file', 'tempest.config', group='scenario') CONF.import_opt('ami_img_file', 'tempest.config', group='scenario') CONF.import_opt('ssh_user', 'tempest.config', group='scenario') LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) DEFAULT_MAX_RETRIES = 5 DEFAULT_RETRY_INTERVAL = 2 HTTP_SERVER_PORT = 8033 class BaremetalStandaloneOps(manager.BaremetalScenarioTest): def get_my_ip(self): admin_manager = clients.AdminManager() services = admin_manager.service_client.list_services() ironic_id = '' for service in services: if service['name'] == 'ironic': ironic_id = service['id'] break endpoints = admin_manager.endpoints_client.list_endpoints() ironic_url = '' for endpoint in endpoints: if endpoint['service_id'] == ironic_id: ironic_url = endpoint['url'] break return urlparse.urlparse(ironic_url).hostname def start_http_server(self): old_dir = os.getcwd() os.chdir(CONF.baremetal.deploy_img_dir) httpd = BaseHTTPServer.HTTPServer( ('', HTTP_SERVER_PORT), SimpleHTTPServer.SimpleHTTPRequestHandler ) t = threading.Thread(target=httpd.serve_forever) t.daemon = True t.start() self.addCleanup(httpd.shutdown) self.addCleanup(os.chdir, old_dir) return 'http://%s:%s' % (self.get_my_ip(), HTTP_SERVER_PORT) def construct_images_dict(self, images_server_addr): chksum = None img_dir = CONF.scenario.img_dir cirros_version = re.findall('cirros-(\d\.\d\.\d)-.*', img_dir)[0] dl_server = urlparse.urljoin('http://download.cirros-cloud.net/', cirros_version) if self.deploy_driver.startswith('agent'): image = urlparse.urljoin(images_server_addr, CONF.scenario.img_file) checksums = dl_server + '/MD5SUMS' h = httplib2.Http() resp, content = h.request(checksums) for line in content.split('\n'): if CONF.scenario.img_file in line: chksum = line.split(' ')[0] break else: image = 'file://%s' % os.path.join(img_dir, CONF.scenario.ami_img_file) depl_prefix = 'ir-deploy-%s' % self.deploy_driver depl_kernel = urlparse.urljoin(images_server_addr, '%s.kernel' % depl_prefix) depl_ramdisk = urlparse.urljoin(images_server_addr, '%s.initramfs' % depl_prefix) kernel = 'file://%s' % os.path.join(img_dir, CONF.scenario.aki_img_file) ramdisk = 'file://%s' % os.path.join(img_dir, CONF.scenario.ari_img_file) ret_dict = { 'driver_info/deploy_kernel': depl_kernel, 'driver_info/deploy_ramdisk': depl_ramdisk, 'instance_info/image_source': image, } if not self.deploy_driver.startswith('agent'): ret_dict.update({'instance_info/kernel': kernel, 'instance_info/ramdisk': ramdisk}) else: ret_dict.update({'instance_info/image_checksum': chksum}) return ret_dict def make_configdrive(self, path): """Make the config drive file. :param path: The directory containing the config drive files. :returns: A gzipped and base64 encoded configdrive string. """ # Make sure path it's readable self.assertTrue(os.access(path, os.R_OK), 'The directory "%s" is not readable' % path) with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() as tmpfile: with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() as tmpzipfile: publisher = 'ironicclient-configdrive 0.1' p = subprocess.Popen(['genisoimage', '-o', tmpfile.name, '-ldots', '-allow-lowercase', '-allow-multidot', '-l', '-publisher', publisher, '-quiet', '-J', '-r', '-V', 'config-2', path], stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE) stdout, stderr = p.communicate() self.assertEqual(0, p.returncode, 'Error generating the config drive. ' 'Stdout: "%(stdout)s". Stderr: %(stderr)s' % {'stdout': stdout, 'stderr': stderr}) # Compress file tmpfile.seek(0) g = gzip.GzipFile(fileobj=tmpzipfile, mode='wb') shutil.copyfileobj(tmpfile, g) g.close() tmpzipfile.seek(0) return base64.b64encode(tmpzipfile.read()) def build_configdrive(self): configdrive_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp() meta_data_dir = os.path.join(configdrive_dir, 'openstack', 'latest') os.makedirs(meta_data_dir) with open(os.path.join(meta_data_dir, 'meta_data.json'), 'w') as meta: meta_data = { 'uuid': self.node['uuid'], 'public_keys': { self.keypair['name']: self.keypair['public_key'] } } meta.write(json.dumps(meta_data)) configdrive_str = self.make_configdrive(configdrive_dir) shutil.rmtree(configdrive_dir) return configdrive_str def set_provision_state_with_retries(self, state, configdrive=None): count = 0 while count < DEFAULT_MAX_RETRIES: try: self.baremetal_client.set_node_provision_state( self.node['uuid'], state, configdrive ) break except tempest_lib_exc.Conflict: time.sleep(DEFAULT_RETRY_INTERVAL) count += 1 self.assertLess(count, DEFAULT_MAX_RETRIES, 'Cannot set provision state because of conflict, ' 'tried %s times.' % DEFAULT_MAX_RETRIES) def create_port(self, mac_address): body = self.network_client.list_networks( name=CONF.compute.fixed_network_name ) net_id = body['networks'][0]['id'] admin_manager = clients.AdminManager() body = admin_manager.network_client.create_port( network_id=net_id, mac_address=mac_address ) self.neutron_port = body['port'] if not self.deploy_driver.startswith('agent'): self.addCleanup(admin_manager.network_client.delete_port, self.neutron_port['id']) def boot_node(self, images_server_addr): _, body = self.baremetal_client.list_nodes_detail() # Sort by creation time as baremetal node is the first node created # by devstack sorted_nodes = sorted(body['nodes'], key=lambda n: n['created_at']) node = sorted_nodes[0] self.deploy_driver = node['driver'] images_info = self.construct_images_dict(images_server_addr) images_info['instance_info/root_gb'] = 10 old_deploy_images = { 'driver_info/' + img: node['driver_info'].get(img) for img in ('deploy_kernel', 'deploy_ramdisk') } resp, node = self.baremetal_client.update_node(node['uuid'], **images_info) self.addCleanup(self.baremetal_client.update_node, node['uuid'], **old_deploy_images) self.node = node _, body = self.baremetal_client.list_node_ports(node['uuid']) port = body['ports'][0] node_mac = port['address'] self.create_port(node_mac) port_attributes = ('extra/vif_port_id',) patch = self.baremetal_client._make_patch(port_attributes, **{ 'extra/vif_port_id': self.neutron_port['id'] }) self.baremetal_client.update_port(port['uuid'], patch) configdrive = self.build_configdrive() self.set_provision_state_with_retries('active', configdrive) self.wait_provisioning_state(self.node['uuid'], manager.BaremetalProvisionStates.ACTIVE, timeout=CONF.baremetal.active_timeout) def rebuild_node(self): self.set_provision_state_with_retries('rebuild') self.wait_provisioning_state(self.node['uuid'], manager.BaremetalProvisionStates.ACTIVE, timeout=CONF.baremetal.active_timeout) def unprovision_node(self): self.set_provision_state_with_retries('deleted') self.wait_provisioning_state( self.node['uuid'], manager.BaremetalProvisionStates.NOSTATE, timeout=CONF.baremetal.unprovision_timeout ) def create_remote_file(self, client, filename): """Create a file on the remote client connection. After creating the file, force a filesystem sync. Otherwise, if we issue a rebuild too quickly, the file may not exist. """ client.exec_command('touch ' + filename) client.exec_command('sync') out = client.exec_command('ls ' + filename).strip() self.assertEqual(filename, out) def validate_ports(self): for port in self.get_ports(self.node['uuid']): n_port_id = port['extra']['vif_port_id'] admin_manager = clients.AdminManager() body = admin_manager.network_client.show_port(n_port_id) n_port = body['port'] self.assertEqual(n_port['mac_address'], port['address']) @lockutils.synchronized('baremetal-scenario-lock', external=True) @test.idempotent_id('8fd45f87-c2e1-4dbc-a899-cd298b837438') @test.services('baremetal', 'compute', 'network') def test_baremetal_server_standalone_ops(self): test_filename = '/home/cirros/rebuild_test.txt' http_server_addr = self.start_http_server() self.add_keypair() self.boot_node(http_server_addr) self.validate_ports() vm_client = self.get_remote_client( self.neutron_port['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'], CONF.scenario.ssh_user, self.keypair['private_key'] ) self.create_remote_file(vm_client, test_filename) self.rebuild_node() self.create_remote_file(vm_client, test_filename) self.unprovision_node()

commit_message:
Import and deploy TOSCA CSAR packages

Add a custom plugin to support importing Murano application definition
archives of TOSCA CSAR files into Murano application catalog, and
deploy them through the catalog to Heat.

Co-Authored-By: Tetiana Lashchova <tlashchova@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ibb9b7f22853040ef1c453db2cebae727f6514286
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-tosca-format

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import yaml from murano.packages import exceptions from murano.packages import package_base from toscaparser.prereq.csar import CSAR class Dumper(yaml.SafeDumper): pass class CSARPackage(package_base.PackageBase): def __init__(self, format_name, runtime_version, source_directory, manifest): super(CSARPackage, self).__init__( format_name, runtime_version, source_directory, manifest) self._translated_class = None self._source_directory = source_directory self._translated_ui = None @property def classes(self): return self.full_name, @property def requirements(self): return {} @property def ui(self): if not self._translated_ui: self._translated_ui = self._translate_ui() return self._translated_ui def get_class(self, name): if name != self.full_name: raise exceptions.PackageClassLoadError( name, 'Class not defined in this package') if not self._translated_class: self._translate_class() return self._translated_class, '<generated code>' @staticmethod def _translate_ui_parameters(csar, title): result_groups = [] predefined_fields = [ { 'name': 'title', 'type': 'string', 'required': False, 'hidden': True, 'description': title }, { 'name': 'name', 'type': 'string', 'label': 'Application Name', 'required': True, 'description': 'Enter a desired name for the application.' ' Just A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and dash are allowed' } ] used_inputs = set() csar_inputs = csar.get('topology_template').get('inputs') or {} fields = [] properties = [] for input in csar_inputs: input_value = csar_inputs.get(input) if input_value: fields.append(CSARPackage._translate_ui_parameter( input, input_value)) used_inputs.add(input) properties.append(input) result_groups.append((fields, properties)) rest_group = [] properties = [] for key, value in csar_inputs.iteritems(): if key not in used_inputs: rest_group.append(CSARPackage._translate_ui_parameter( key, value)) properties.append(key) if rest_group: result_groups.append((rest_group, properties)) result_groups.insert(0, (predefined_fields, ['name'])) return result_groups def _translate_ui(self): tosca = CSAR(os.path.join(self._source_directory, 'csar.zip'))\ .get_main_template_yaml() groups = CSARPackage._translate_ui_parameters(tosca, self.description) forms = [] for i, record in enumerate(groups): forms.append({'group{0}'.format(i): {'fields': record[0]}}) translated = { 'Version': 2, 'Application': CSARPackage._generate_application_ui( groups, self.full_name), 'Forms': forms } return yaml.dump(translated, Dumper=Dumper, default_style='"')

subject: Disable DHCP completely when no nodes are on introspection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-16 10:34:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/74fbace57ebc098349eadc59acaa26b8e1840520', 'message': "[WIP] Disable DHCP completely when no nodes are on introspection

Currently we keep DHCP always open for new nodes. This is an overkill, as we
always know which nodes are on introspection. It also causes problems when not
all node NIC's are registered in Ironic, as these NIC's might get DHCP from our
server.

This change reduces probability of wrong nodes accessing our DHCP by REJECT'ing
all DHCP requests when no nodes are on introspection and node_not_found_hook is
not set.

commit_message:
Disable DHCP completely when no nodes are on introspection

Currently we keep DHCP always open for new nodes. This is an overkill, as we
always know which nodes are on introspection. It also causes problems when not
all node NIC's are registered in Ironic, as these NIC's might get DHCP from our
server.

This change reduces probability of wrong nodes accessing our DHCP by REJECT'ing
all DHCP requests when no nodes are on introspection and node_not_found_hook is
not set. It does not solve the problem completely: conflicts are still possible
during the introspection.

Change-Id: I7a50c02023ef4364e14825cd80fa75565fac3dc8
Partial-Bug: #1557979

added_lines: import contextlibENABLED = Truedef _should_enable_dhcp(): """Check whether we should enable DHCP at all. We won't even open our DHCP if no nodes are on introspection and node_not_found_hook is not set. """ return (node_cache.introspection_active() or CONF.processing.node_not_found_hook) @contextlib.contextmanager def _temporary_chain(chain, main_chain): """Context manager to operate on a temporary chain.""" # Clean up a bit to account for possible troubles on previous run _clean_up(chain) _iptables('-N', chain) yield # Swap chains _iptables('-I', 'INPUT', '-i', INTERFACE, '-p', 'udp', '--dport', '67', '-j', chain) _iptables('-D', 'INPUT', '-i', INTERFACE, '-p', 'udp', '--dport', '67', '-j', main_chain, ignore=True) _iptables('-F', main_chain, ignore=True) _iptables('-X', main_chain, ignore=True) _iptables('-E', chain, main_chain) def _disable_dhcp(): """Disable DHCP completely.""" global ENABLED if not ENABLED: LOG.debug('DHCP is already disabled, not updating') return LOG.debug('No nodes on introspection and node_not_found_hook is ' 'not set - disabling DHCP') with _temporary_chain(NEW_CHAIN, CHAIN): # Blacklist everything _iptables('-A', NEW_CHAIN, '-j', 'REJECT') ENABLED = False global BLACKLIST_CACHE, ENABLED if not _should_enable_dhcp(): _disable_dhcp() return with _temporary_chain(NEW_CHAIN, CHAIN): # - Blacklist active macs, so that nova can boot them for mac in to_blacklist: _iptables('-A', NEW_CHAIN, '-m', 'mac', '--mac-source', mac, '-j', 'DROP') # - Whitelist everything else _iptables('-A', NEW_CHAIN, '-j', 'ACCEPT') ENABLED = True
deleted_lines: global BLACKLIST_CACHE # Clean up a bit to account for possible troubles on previous run _clean_up(NEW_CHAIN) # Operate on temporary chain _iptables('-N', NEW_CHAIN) # - Blacklist active macs, so that nova can boot them for mac in to_blacklist: _iptables('-A', NEW_CHAIN, '-m', 'mac', '--mac-source', mac, '-j', 'DROP') # - Whitelist everything else _iptables('-A', NEW_CHAIN, '-j', 'ACCEPT') # Swap chains _iptables('-I', 'INPUT', '-i', INTERFACE, '-p', 'udp', '--dport', '67', '-j', NEW_CHAIN) _iptables('-D', 'INPUT', '-i', INTERFACE, '-p', 'udp', '--dport', '67', '-j', CHAIN, ignore=True) _iptables('-F', CHAIN, ignore=True) _iptables('-X', CHAIN, ignore=True) _iptables('-E', NEW_CHAIN, CHAIN)

commit_message:
stable: require periodic-<release> jobs for maint

Jobs that are applying for the stable:follows-policy tag
will be held up against the terms we've defined for
active maintenance. We should be explicit about the need
for projects to be running the periodic-<release> jobs
so we can track status in a common way.

Change-Id: I15adc75fd8b3d0c5930ffc2fbfb9c0d57e0f433b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/22/292622/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: Projects with the ``stable:follows-policy`` tag should be running the ``periodic-<release>`` jobs as defined in the `openstack-infra/project-config repo`_. Here is an example of running periodic-kilo and periodic-liberty jobs `on Designate`_. .. _openstack-infra/project-config repo: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/ .. _on Designate: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/292617/

commit_message:
Revert "Tolerate both new and old setuptools"

This reverts commit 0cf3c06ad98fa86378ffd561b65c0154989b179c.

setuptools 20.3 was released today which fixes the
vendorized exception problem.

Change-Id: I24edaf6cb2f0b354e2ebb33451f1f15bfd888183

commit_message:
Add debian-jessie image to nodepool

This patch adds Debian Jessie diskimage-builder image to nodepool.
debian-packageinstall element is based on debian-minimal and provides
additional required packages, change is introduced in
I9486b1356eac74272e79655c9024d86ee486628c

Depends-On: Ic39ba2b5ceb5018efb75742547b2babf80827e56
Depends-On: I7a661c8b5d4bb632eb32b5018c55474c1c66a4e8
Depends-On: I4a5a8352388de46e9e7713fa11951fcde27eaad9
Change-Id: I851cb47e844a72a430b578dd63d8b230ee6e3ed9
Co-Authored-By: Igor Belikov <ibelikov@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add LBaaS v2 support (OSA)

This patch prepares OSA to work with the LBaaS v2 work
proposed in the IRR os_neutron role and provides deployer
documentation for enabling LBaaS v2.

The os_neutron role work is proposed in
change I00b41634816a1f7f1dfb31fcc6f35050c8d223a4.

This is a re-work of the changes proposed in
change I1c9c43582c99ebd1fb7bacb6545bcad34a692880.

Co-Authored-By: Bjoern Teipel <bjoern.teipel@rackspace.com>

Closes-Bug: 1541130
Depends-On: I00b41634816a1f7f1dfb31fcc6f35050c8d223a4
Change-Id: I938d33ef845c8a177ef527555a9e137593cf0cf8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/43/287243/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: horizon_enable_neutron_lbaas: "{% if neutron_plugin_base is defined and 'neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPluginv2' in neutron_plugin_base %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}"
deleted_lines: horizon_enable_neutron_lbaas: "{% if neutron_plugin_base is defined and 'neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPlugin' in neutron_plugin_base %}True{% else %}False{% endif %}"

commit_message:
Add update_reviews tool

This tool lifts all of the user's reviews that they have -2d for
a project using the gerrit REST API.

Change-Id: Ie955417e1d3d068b07a445649dec61c14861f520

commit_message:
Do not make unnecessary calls to Nova from FIPs and Volumes tabs

If none of the floating IPs listed within Horizon are attached to an
instance, do not request a list of Nova instances (because we have no
use for it). Apply the same behavior for Volumes tab (both Admin and
Project). This patch both saves us from making unnecessary and
potentially expensive call to Nova and lays the ground for a more
selective request of instance details from Nova. The latter will be
possible once Nova supports filtering instance details by >1
instance_id. For reference see
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/get-multi-servers-filter

Change-Id: Ie7563b9e03b286b4cf51507463213162af3383b1
Partial-Bug: #1442310

deleted_lines: instances = [] try: instances, has_more = nova.server_list(self.request) except Exception: exceptions.handle(self.request, _('Unable to retrieve instance list.')) instances_dict = dict([(obj.id, obj.name) for obj in instances]) for ip in floating_ips: ip.instance_name = instances_dict.get(ip.instance_id) ip.pool_name = pool_dict.get(ip.pool, ip.pool)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-14 15:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/undercloud/test_undercloud.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/undercloud.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/fab746ba75b1eec0fc0436cf6316810891fdc8d6', 'message': "Add 'undercloud upgrade' command

The undercloud upgrade process entails updating the installed packages,
then running the installer again. However, after updating packages, a
number of services may no longer be able to run, as upon restart the
new code is not compatible with older settings. Therefore, this makes
the upgrade more 'atomic' by bundling the package update and the
undercloud install into a single command. An error (non-zero RC) in the
package update will halt the process.

Change-Id: I269ba919f1648f0e4b30ab710c386dafdad2a68d

commit_message:
Add 'undercloud upgrade' command

The undercloud upgrade process entails updating the installed packages,
then running the installer again. However, after updating packages, a
number of services may no longer be able to run, as upon restart the
new code is not compatible with older settings. Therefore, this makes
the upgrade more 'atomic' by bundling the package update and the
undercloud install into a single command. An error (non-zero RC) in the
package update will halt the process.

Change-Id: I269ba919f1648f0e4b30ab710c386dafdad2a68d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/71/292471/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: undercloud_install = tripleoclient.v1.undercloud:InstallUndercloud undercloud_upgrade = tripleoclient.v1.undercloud:UpgradeUndercloud

commit_message:
Fix reno for RC1

This is a bus for all reno problems we see with the relnotes :

* Change Id25bd4870c6e2fda08dc0177b7ed61a8a6091838 was having
a formatting problem with not retaining the newlines, and also
was mentioning "Nove" :-)

* Change I43ddc5164f88fb049fe49ad4672fbf09b2b1987e was using a
prelude section that is not needed because we will provide a
general prelude section (and commenting that) in the next change.

* Change I2dba71e71b1ed7cf8476e8bfe9481e84be5df128 was incorrectly
using the upgrades section while it was a deprecation.

* Change Ia6f1d8f9c7d700498b6441a6ba37fa25b2611ef8 is no longer
valid because Id7936be290b6febd18deb4c2db8ea4d678d4d9b1 has been
merged during Mitaka too.

* Change I2465e1bee618a552132d659014ea96cdbda161d6 was reverting
a reno file but due to a reno bug (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/293078/), the release note is
still kept in the output. Consequently, the workaround I found
is to reintroduce the same reno file with an empty content to
drop the previous content.

Note that I used the prelude section for "dropping" notes, that
prevents us to provide empty bullets for upgrade or features sections.

Change-Id: I1535aff80850fa3666da739133fc43e8579aa19b

commit_message:
Magic search shouldn't re-appear after selecting facet

When you select a facet, it instantly pops open again, obscuring the
results of the most recent facet.  This is fixed.

To test: Go to Launch Instance / Source, then click in the Available
search bar.  Add facets, and verify that after selecting each facet
opton that the facet drop-down is not shown.

Closes-bug: #1552594

Change-Id: Iffed933131163b6e64297ad8d7cd8912311c3ff0

commit_message:
Replace associators with direct queries (part 2)

Using associators to retrieve different associated classes is a
time expensive operation. The associators can be replaced by
direct queries which improve the performance by decreasing the
time needed to wait to retrieve the associated classes.

Change-Id: I4ce109395b392ffc8e957d58b351779d0b495398

commit_message:
Add --query to alarm list

As discussed in the MailList and aggred, we should now
add --query to alarm list" to perform the functionality
what "alarm search" does.

Change-Id: Icf8888b91f7040d6158919cb667e8fa7d46a54ee
Closes-Bug: #1555910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-aodhclient refs/changes/41/291541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Don't support "alarm search" and mandatory --type in "alarm list"

As discussed in mailing list, we agreed to drop "alarm search" command and
add a --query parameter to "alarm list" to perform what "alarm search"
does. And this patch will also drop mandatory --type in "alarm list", the
--filter parameter will be added(in another patch).

Change-Id: I68c5463fe37e3051b0e52d59f30a0eb36dd62424
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-aodhclient refs/changes/58/283958/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch get_serial_number logging to debug

Make logging less alarming by not using "warning" during retries
Add unit testing, refactor and cleanup code

Change-Id: Ic4e6513f8c3d8c1783b0ac89383f1ed478b2168b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/06/292606/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: retries_left = max_retries while True: response, retry_cnt = self._make_and_send_dns_message( zone, host, port, timeout, retry_interval, retries_left) if zone.serial == 0 and zone.action in ('DELETE', 'NONE'): actual_serial = 0 break # Zone not expected to exist # TODO(vinod): Account for serial number wrap around. Unix # timestamps are used where Designate is primary, but secondary # zones use different values. if actual_serial is not None and actual_serial >= zone.serial: retries_left -= retry_cnt msg = _LW("Got lower serial for '%(zone)s' to '%(host)s:" "%(port)s'. Expected:'%(es)d'. Got:'%(as)s'." "Retries left='%(retries)d'") % { 'zone': zone.name, 'host': host, 'port': port, 'es': zone.serial, 'as': actual_serial, 'retries': retries_left} if not retries_left: # return with error LOG.warning(msg) break LOG.debug(msg) # retry again time.sleep(retry_interval) # Return retries_left for testing purposes. return status, actual_serial, retries_left
deleted_lines: retries = max_retries while (True): (response, retry) = self._make_and_send_dns_message( zone, host, port, timeout, retry_interval, retries) if zone.serial == 0 and zone.action in ['DELETE', 'NONE']: return (status, 0, retries) if actual_serial is None or actual_serial < zone.serial: # TODO(vinod): Account for serial number wrap around. retries = retries - retry LOG.warning(_LW("Got lower serial for '%(zone)s' to '%(host)s:" "%(port)s'. Expected:'%(es)d'. Got:'%(as)s'." "Retries left='%(retries)d'") % {'zone': zone.name, 'host': host, 'port': port, 'es': zone.serial, 'as': actual_serial, 'retries': retries}) if retries > 0: # retry again time.sleep(retry_interval) continue else: break else: # Return retries for testing purposes. return (status, actual_serial, retries)

commit_message:
linux_net: use new exception for ovs-vsctl failures

Failures of ovs-vsctl calls were wrapped into AgentError exception
by mistake - the latter has nothing to do with OVS and is solely
a xenapi thing.

Add a new exception specific for ovs-vsctl failures.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I74bbfe614917f6bd0b18bd45db5d844dbb8c0437

commit_message:
Fix network duplication check logic

Previously api.neutron.Network object was compared by using _apidict
but it did not work when for example the order of subnet list is different.
This commit changes the comparison logic to use network ID explicitly.
In addition, it moves the logic to fetch external networks to api.neutron.

Change-Id: Ie3a42e29c32c17a7f3bf1596b0e09cb73eae9d2a
Closes-Bug: #1528465

commit_message:
Dump thresholds as JSON, not python repr()

The python repr is very similar to JSON, except it prefixes strings
with u, which prevents them from parsing as JSON.

Change-Id: I1b17372ef5adaf4bc53f064a0a9eca1bfce54a62

commit_message:
Fix for TCP connections not sending full content

Eventlet previously broke the standard API for sockets
and made socket.send() work in the same manor as socket.sendall()

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/c315ee86dac996ac533b738f7c8777f4d01a0472
reverted to the standard behaviour.

This was released as part of 0.18.0.

The bug manifests itself when large (multi TCP message) AXFRs are
performed over long distances.

(I replicated it when the messages grew to 3,
over USWest -> EU transfer)

see http://graham.hayes.ie/posts/minidns-tcp-and-the-internet/
for details on testing.

This change can cause packets to be dropped intermitently -
but retry will allow this to be overcome.

Change-Id: Ia0c15d843fb2092cc693b37dc701492396c647d0
Closes-Bug: #1552864

commit_message:
Revert "launchpad bug 1537330, fix _is_active_nic"

This reverts commit cb4f56f72cd9a194661762c343c48392d70ba6ce.

We think this might be causing some spurious failures in our
CI environment where the NIC mapping is sometimes incorrect.

Related-bug: #1555749

commit_message:
Return image id when backup

image snapshot create returns the image uuid , there is no difference
between backup and snapshot function mainly, so we can return the
image uuid as well, something like openstackclient can consume
this return value and do its additional work.

Change-Id: I23ee9a954dd4aee41a74109db667e0a0640332d6

commit_message:
Fix test isolation issues related to versions

In cinder.rpc.RPCAPI methods _determine_rpc_version_cap and
_determine_obj_version_cap use global variables LAST_RPC_VERSIONS and
LAST_OBJ_VERSIONS to cache version values so we need to clear these
values between tests so one test values don't get passed to the next
test.

This was problematic for example when running some
cinder.tests.unit.api.contrib tests in a specific order:

- test_admin_actions.AdminActionsTest.test_delete_backup_force_when_creating
- test_backups.BackupsAPITestCase.test_create_backup_snapshot_json

Change-Id: I073557a6e0a17a3e00fd32d48d389a3bcf42e341
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/18/287218/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(geguileo): This is required because _determine_obj_version_cap # and _determine_rpc_version_cap functions in cinder.rpc.RPCAPI cache # versions in LAST_RPC_VERSIONS and LAST_OBJ_VERSIONS so we may have # weird interactions between tests if we don't clear them before each # test. rpc.LAST_OBJ_VERSIONS = {} rpc.LAST_RPC_VERSIONS = {}

subject: Fix command not found in scripts lib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-16 09:05:39.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/1dbcd5096fbad32c000ec8643efeb506ad07f18d', 'message': 'Fix command not found in scripts lib

The successorator originally incremented RETRY with ((RETRY++)).
Bashate decided that was an ambiguous redirect  (why?, I don't care
about the output, I just want the variable to incremented). As a result
we changed the increment statement to $((RETRY++)), this increments the
variable, then tries to execute it, so the log contains:

"scripts/scripts-library.sh: line 51: 1: command not found"

I was going to add _=$((RETRY++)) but its getting ugly, so I replaced
the while loop with a c-style for loop that allows the increment
operator in the third statement.

Change-Id: I3db03dcefbcbe2b4c51e414f9fd2fee73e16a62e
(cherry picked from commit 02c555ae0b4ee318c2e1b9637469cd99247f2976)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix command not found in scripts lib

The successorator originally incremented RETRY with ((RETRY++)).
Bashate decided that was an ambiguous redirect  (why?, I don't care
about the output, I just want the variable to incremented). As a result
we changed the increment statement to $((RETRY++)), this increments the
variable, then tries to execute it, so the log contains:

"scripts/scripts-library.sh: line 51: 1: command not found"

I was going to add _=$((RETRY++)) but its getting ugly, so I replaced
the while loop with a c-style for loop that allows the increment
operator in the third statement.

Change-Id: I3db03dcefbcbe2b4c51e414f9fd2fee73e16a62e
(cherry picked from commit 02c555ae0b4ee318c2e1b9637469cd99247f2976)

commit_message:
Always assign a name to created images

This is necessary for name-based cleanup. If a name is not specified,
one will be generated automatically. The ability to explicitly set a
name is necessary for the images context.

Implements: blueprint cleanup-refactoring
Change-Id: I895c72b1922bdb8a1e9b7b2955d0ff88b5017f3d

commit_message:
hyper-v: Copies back files on failed migration

On cold migration, the contents of the instance folder are
copied to the new host. The original folder cannot be removed
because the VM configuration files cannot be deleted until the VM
is destroyed.

Because of this, when the migration fails to copy the files, it will
try to revert this through folder renaming. Since the original folder
still exists, an exception is raised.

Change-Id: Ia42ed873924999d57336a105bcaa2b856f3a3a9d
Closes-Bug: #1555699

subject: Fix command not found in scripts lib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-16 09:05:51.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/4b1255aaeacbd1e4a28afdbd20cddef8a4ca05af', 'message': 'Fix command not found in scripts lib

The successorator originally incremented RETRY with ((RETRY++)).
Bashate decided that was an ambiguous redirect  (why?, I don't care
about the output, I just want the variable to incremented). As a result
we changed the increment statement to $((RETRY++)), this increments the
variable, then tries to execute it, so the log contains:

"scripts/scripts-library.sh: line 51: 1: command not found"

I was going to add _=$((RETRY++)) but its getting ugly, so I replaced
the while loop with a c-style for loop that allows the increment
operator in the third statement.

Change-Id: I3db03dcefbcbe2b4c51e414f9fd2fee73e16a62e
(cherry picked from commit 02c555ae0b4ee318c2e1b9637469cd99247f2976)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix command not found in scripts lib

The successorator originally incremented RETRY with ((RETRY++)).
Bashate decided that was an ambiguous redirect  (why?, I don't care
about the output, I just want the variable to incremented). As a result
we changed the increment statement to $((RETRY++)), this increments the
variable, then tries to execute it, so the log contains:

"scripts/scripts-library.sh: line 51: 1: command not found"

I was going to add _=$((RETRY++)) but its getting ugly, so I replaced
the while loop with a c-style for loop that allows the increment
operator in the third statement.

Change-Id: I3db03dcefbcbe2b4c51e414f9fd2fee73e16a62e
(cherry picked from commit 02c555ae0b4ee318c2e1b9637469cd99247f2976)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/25/293325/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for ((RETRY=0; $? != 0 && RETRY < MAX_RETRIES; RETRY++)); do

commit_message:
Allow using 'get_param' for 'deletion_policy' section

Make sure to create stack successful if 'deletion_policy'
section using function 'get_param':
1. Allow Function as valid type when 'deletion_policy'
section validation.
2. Resolve 'deletion_policy' data before deletion_policy
checking when rsrc_defn init.

Change-Id: Idee0ed90c34cfbfb09546969b144496d757195d8
Closes-Bug: #1556790

commit_message:
Disallow delete a bay created by another user

Right now in Magnum, 500 error is returned when user A delete a bay
create by user B. We should change the policy rule to avoid this
action, after thsi changee, a 403 error is returned instead of 500.

Change-Id: I02d21777d508078414c905e6fb5870d98388d177
Closes-Bug: #1552457

commit_message:
clear pycache and remove all pyc/pyo before starting unit test

Delete python bytecode before every test run.
Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Closes-Bug: #1368661
Change-Id: Iedcb400fa3b0417f5bb8e943b17758fcfb4070c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/76/254276/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete nosetests {posargs:test/unit} whitelist_externals = find

commit_message:
Fix ssync related object-server docs

Swift now uses SSYNC verb instead of old REPLICATION verb for ssync
protocol. This patch replaces all docs written as REPLICATION into
SSYNC and fix a few words for explanation.

Change-Id: I1253210d4f49749e7d425d6252dd262b650d9548
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/57/292257/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set to restrict the number of concurrent incoming SSYNC requests# Note that SSYNC is currently an item for ssync replicatior or reconstructor# Restricts incoming SSYNC requests to one per device,# device, but you may wish to set this to False to allow multiple SSYNC
deleted_lines: # Set to restrict the number of concurrent incoming REPLICATION requests# Note that REPLICATION is currently an ssync only item# Restricts incoming REPLICATION requests to one per device,# device, but you may wish to set this to False to allow multiple REPLICATION

commit_message:
Add rbac manual for qos-policy

Change-Id: I7ce9a2e91cfc8681bd874cee6dbf8e9391e708b6
Closes-Bug: #1550559
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/76/291276/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================= Role-Based Access Control ========================= Supported objects for sharing with specific projects ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Currently, the access that can be granted using this feature is suppoprted by: * Regular port creation permissions on networks. * Binding QoS policies permissions to networks or ports. Sharing an object with specific projects ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Sharing an object with a specific project is accomplished by creating a policy entry that permits the target project the ``access_as_shared`` action on that object. Sharing a qos-policy with specific projects ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Create a qos-policy to share: .. code-block:: console $ neutron qos-policy-create secret_policy Created a new policy: +-------------+--------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +-------------+--------------------------------------+ | description | | | id | e45e6917-3f3f-4835-ad54-d12c9151541d | | name | secret_policy | | rules | | | shared | False | | tenant_id | 5b32b072f8354942ab13b6decb1294b3 | +-------------+--------------------------------------+ Create the rbac policy entry using the :command:`rbac-create` command (In this example, the ID of the project we want to share with is ``a6bf6cfbcd1f4e32a57d2138b6bd41d1``): .. code-block:: console $ neutron rbac-create --target-tenant a6bf6cfbcd1f4e32a57d2138b6bd41d1 \ --action access_as_shared --type qos-policy e45e6917-3f3f-4835-ad54-d12c9151541d Created a new rbac_policy: +---------------+--------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +---------------+--------------------------------------+ | action | access_as_shared | | id | ec2e3db1-de5b-4043-9d95-156f582653d0 | | object_id | e45e6917-3f3f-4835-ad54-d12c9151541d | | object_type | qos_policy | | target_tenant | a6bf6cfbcd1f4e32a57d2138b6bd41d1 | | tenant_id | 5b32b072f8354942ab13b6decb1294b3 | +---------------+--------------------------------------+ The ``target-tenant`` parameter specifies the project that requires access to the qos-policy. The ``action`` parameter specifies what the project is allowed to do. The ``type`` parameter says that the target object is a qos-policy. The final parameter is the ID of the qos-policy we are granting access to. Project ``a6bf6cfbcd1f4e32a57d2138b6bd41d1`` will now be able to see the network when running :command:`qos-policy-list` and :command:`qos-policy-show` and will also be able to bind it to its ports or networks. No other users (other than admins and the owner) will be able to see the qos-policy. To remove access for that project, delete the policy that allows it using the :command:`rbac-delete` command: .. code-block:: console $ neutron rbac-delete e45e6917-3f3f-4835-ad54-d12c9151541d Deleted rbac_policy: e45e6917-3f3f-4835-ad54-d12c9151541d If that project has ports or networks, with the qos-policy applied to them, the server will prevent the rbac-policy from being deleted until the qos-policy is no longer in use: .. code-block:: console $ neutron rbac-delete e45e6917-3f3f-4835-ad54-d12c9151541d RBAC policy on object e45e6917-3f3f-4835-ad54-d12c9151541d cannot be removed because other objects depend on it. This process can be repeated any number of times to share a qos-policy with an arbitrary number of projects. making an object (``network``, ``qos-policy``) available to every project. This is accomplished using the ``shared`` flag on the supported object: +--------------------------------------+-------------+--------------------------------------+ | id | object_type | object_id | +--------------------------------------+-------------+--------------------------------------+ | ec2e3db1-de5b-4043-9d95-156f582653d0 | qos_policy | e45e6917-3f3f-4835-ad54-d12c9151541d | | e7b7a4a7-8c3e-4003-9e15-5a9464c1ecea | network | fcc63ae1-c56e-449d-8fb0-4f49f3cc8b55 | +--------------------------------------+-------------+--------------------------------------+ Preventing regular users from sharing objects with each other ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~users to share objects with every other project using a wildcard; however, it will allow them to share objects with specific project
deleted_lines: ====================================== Role-Based Access Control for networks ======================================Currently, the only access that can be granted using this feature is regular port creation permissions on networks.Sharing a network with a specific project is accomplished by creating a policy entry that permits the target project the ``access_as_shared`` action on that network. making a network available to every project. This is accomplished using the ``shared`` flag on the network: +--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | id | object_id | +--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | fcc63ae1-c56e-449d-8fb0-4f49f3cc8b55 | 9a4af544-7158-456d-b180-95f2e11eaa8c | +--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+Preventing regular users from sharing networks with each other ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~users to share networks with every other project using a wildcard; however, it will allow them to share networks with specific project

revisions:

As python3 does not support unicode() method any more,

Change-Id: I865f6ba44663dd3a6b437e65078ee6066be6e650
'}]
commit_message:
Use six.text_type() instead of unicode()

As python3 does not support unicode() method any more,
so this patch tries to replace it with six.text_type().

Change-Id: I865f6ba44663dd3a6b437e65078ee6066be6e650
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/56/293256/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return six.text_type(self.args[0]).encode('utf-8') return six.text_type(self.args[0])

commit_message:
WIP: Add Nova config for os_ironic role

This patch configures Nova for use with Ironic, noting that
without moving to cells, an openstack-ansible install can support
only one type of hypervisor at a time (i.e. kvm or ironic etc).
Setting the nova_virt_type determines whether Nova is configured
for Ironic. If it is left unset, the default kvm hypervisor
is used.

Note: This is a WIP as lab testing is not yet complete.
Do NOT merge as is.

Change-Id: I0c5f0a3ea612e96d73546d40b1599e5e4673cb68
Signed-off-by: Michael Davies <michael@the-davies.net>
Depends-On: Ide66c7ee59192ac441ac2919028eca0ad665ceea
Depends-On: I590f5ade90b3e37af7f1b8ee333000d4f993f8c5
Partially-implements: blueprint role-ironic
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/65/282965/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Configure Nova Compute for Ironic set_fact: nova_compute_driver: nova.virt.ironic.IronicDriver nova_firewalldriver: nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver nova_scheduler_host_manager: nova.scheduler.ironic_host_manager.IronicHostManager nova_ram_allocation_ratio: 1.0 nova_reserved_host_memory_mb: 0 nova_compute_manager: ironic.nova.compute.manager.ClusteredComputeManager nova_scheduler_use_baremetal_filters: True nova_scheduler_tracks_instance_changes: False when: nova_virt_type == 'ironic' tags: - nova-config - nova-post-install - ironic-post-install

commit_message:
devstackgaterc: Disable unrelated services

By explicitly specifying the list of services.
This effectively disable the following services:

    c-api
    c-bak
    c-sch
    c-vol
    ceilometer-acentral
    ceilometer-acompute
    ceilometer-alarm-evaluator
    ceilometer-alarm-notifier
    ceilometer-anotification
    ceilometer-api
    ceilometer-collector
    cinder
    horizon
    q-fwaas
    q-lbaas
    s-account
    s-container
    s-object
    s-proxy

Closes-Bug: #1555457
Change-Id: I1d8b23a4942a33bf872306a9c10e553ab4e742aa

* Ubuntu jobs are stable again on scenario003 and beaker, let's enable
  voting again.

commit_message:
Add a core group for zaqar-ui

Now Zaqar-ui gets a good support from Horizon team and several
UI experts are working on zaqar UI. So it doesn't make sense
now to use the zaqar-core team to manage the zaqar UI project.
This patch proposes a new group for zaqar UI.

Change-Id: I85a1374584e1f56f9785f6f94a30ce8e4db5dd0e

commit_message:
[inspector] create a separate class for configuring logging

Also makes the default log directory /var/log/ironic-inspector.
Also default "debug" to the service default, not to "false".

Change-Id: If243d78ce16d43135533cd61526172948d2f6ede

commit_message:
Remove the messaging tasks from the role

This change removes the messaging tasks from this role because
they will be relocated into the play in OpenStack-Ansible.

Change-Id: I691cede9fb9cbd9878ad7fac83c2367c97dd7a01
Depends-On: I3016039692d8130654fe1bff422f24ef2afc196e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
